title: Small Farm Irrigation - Video 1 - How to Attach a Lay Flat Header Pipe to a Garden Hose Faucet

tasks.task: Attach a lay flat header pipe to a garden hose using various plumbing components and techniques.
subtasks: Use a clamp and lubricant to attach a gray barbed connector to the lay flat header.
Wrap Teflon tape clockwise around the threads of a 2-inch male PVC coupler.
Secure the PVC coupler into the gray barbed connector with a pipe wrench.
Apply PVC glue to the threads of a 3/4-inch female reduced threaded piece and the inside of the 2-inch coupler.
Wrap Teflon tape around the threads of a 3/4-inch female connector and screw it into the reducer.
Apply additional PVC glue to connect a short piece of 3/4-inch PVC pipe.
Attach a valve to the PVC pipe, ensuring correct flow direction.
Glue another short piece of PVC and a 3/4-inch female connector to the valve.
Clean the water hose or faucet and apply Teflon tape to its threads.
Install a fertigation system component if desired, positioning it centrally in the pipe.

tasks.task: Install a simple irrigation system on a small scale.
subtasks: Verify the proper function and setup of the irrigation system components.
